description: TO AMEND S. 3023, A BILL AMENDING THE NATIONAL BANKING LAWS, BY PROVIDING THAT AFTER JUNE 1, 1908, EVERY NATIONAL BANKING ASSOCIATION ORGANIZED UNDER ACT OF JUNE 3, 1864, SHALL AT ALL TIMES HAVE ON HAND, AN AMOUNT OF LAWFUL U.S. MONEY, EQUAL TO 15% OF AGGREGATE DEPOSITS INSTEAD OF 25% OF RESERVE BONDS, AND ALSO THAT COUNTY BANKS SHOULD ABIDE BY THIS RULING THEREBY ELIMINATING RESERVE BANKS AND EQUALIZING RESERVE FUNDS IN ALL BANKS.  (P. 3861-1,2)

TO AMEND S. 3023, SO AS TO PREVENT THE GOV'T. FROM HAVING A PRIOR CLAIM AGAINST ANY BANKING ASSOCIATION TO WHOM IT HAS ISSUED BANK NOTES UPON SECURITIES, WHEN SUCH SECURITIES FAIL TO BECOME SUFFICIENT TO INDEMNIFY THE GOVERNMENT FOR THE AMOUNT IT PAID FOR THE REDEMPTION OF BANK NOTES. (P. 3866-2)

TO AMEND S. 3023, BY AUTHORIZING THE NATIONAL BANKING ASSOCIATIONS, UNDER THE SUPERVISION OF COMPTROLLER OF CURRENCY, TO MAKE LOANS NOT EXCEEDING ONE THIRD OF THEIR CAPITAL AND SURPLUS UPON PERSONAL NOTE OR BOND SECURED BY FIRST MORTGAGE UPON IMPROVED, OCCUPIED AND CULTIVATED FARMS, AND THE LOAN IN NO CASE TO EXCEED ONE HALF THE CASH VALUE OF THE FARM.  (P. 3874-2)

TO PASS THE RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT THE CREDENTIALS OF JOHN WALTER SMITH, CLAIMING A SEAT IN THE SENATE FROM THE STATE OF MARYLAND, BE TAKEN FROM THE FILES OF THE SENATE AND REFERRED TO THE COMMITTEE ON PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS FOR AN EARLY REPORT ON SAME, THEREBY DELAYING ACTION ON THE SEATING OF THE SAID JOHN SMITH.

TO AMEND S. 3023, BY INCREASING FROM ONE TO TWO PER CENT THE INTEREST TO BE PAID BY ALL NATIONAL BANKING ASSOCIATIONS DESIGNATED AS REGULAR DEPOSITORIES OF PUBLIC MONEY AND RECEIVING SPECIAL AND REGULAR DEPOSITS FROM THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY OF PUBLIC MONEY, SUCH INTEREST TO BE BASED UPON THE MONTHLY AVERAGE OF DEPOSITS.  (P. 3961-1)
TO AMEND S. 3023, BY INCLUDING THE BONDS OF THE GOVERNMENT OF THE PHILIPPINE ISLANDS AS SECURITY FOR GOV'T. DEPOSITS. (P. 3965-2)

TO AMEND S. 3023, BY INCLUDING COTTON WAREHOUSE AND GRAIN ELEVATOR RECEIPTS, NOT TO EXCEED 75% OF THEIR FACE VALUE, AMONG THE SECURITIES SPECIFIED AS BEING REQUIRED BY LAW TO FORM PART OF THE RESERVE OF NATIONAL BANKING ASSOCIATIONS LOCATED OUTSIDE OF RESERVE OR CENTRAL RESERVE CITIES. (P. 4001-1)

TO AMEND S. 3023, BY REQUIRING ALL NATIONAL BANKING ASSOC- IATIONS LOCATED OUTSIDE OF CENTRAL OR CENTRAL RESERVE CITIES TO KEEP IN THEIR OWN VAULTS, IN LAWFUL MONEY OF THE U.S., FOUR-FIFTHS OF THEIR LEGAL RESERVE.  (P. 4001-2)

TO AMEND S. 3023, BY PROVIDING THAT ONE HALF OF ALL TAXES PAID BY NATIONAL BANKING ASSOCIATIONS BASED ON NOTES IN CIRCULATION BE SET APART IN THE U.S. TREASURY, AS A PERMANENT FUND TERMED, "DEPOSITORS FUND", TO BE PAID TO ALL DEPOSITORS EXCEPT THE U.S. IN EVENT OF INSOLVENCY. (P. 4003-2)

TO AMEND S. 3023, BY PREVENTING NAT'L BANKING ASSOCIATIONS FROM MAKING LOANS OR EXTENDING CREDIT, FROM BUYING STOCKS, BONDS, OR AGRICULTURAL FOOD PRODUCTS FOR SPECULATIVE PURPOSES, WHICH IN THE AGGREGATE EXCEED ITS UNIMPAIRED CAPITAL STOCK.  (P. 4016-2)

TO AMEND S. 3023, BY AUTHORIZING THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY, WHENEVER HE DEEMS BUSINESS CONDITIONS REQUIRE IT, TO DEPOSIT $500,000,000 IN BANKS DESIGNATED AS DEPOSTIORIES OF PUBLIC MONEY TO BE APPORTIONED AMONG SEVERAL STATES ACCORDING TO PROPULATION AND TO THE BANKS IN PORPORTION TO THEIR CAPITAL AND SURPLUS, AND ALSO TO ISSUE NOTES SECURED TO THE EXTENT OF THE ABOVE AMOUNT IN THE AMOUNT OF $5 TO $10,000, SAID NOTES PROPOSING ALL THE LEGAL QUALITIES OF U.S. NOTES NOW OUTSTANDING.  (P. 4021-1)

TO AMEND S. 3023, BY PROVIDING THAT THE SECRETARY OF TREASURY SHALL IMMEDIATELY CAUSE TO BE PREPARED, U.S. NOTES TO THE EXTENT OF $500,000,000 AND THESE NOTES SHALL POSSESS ALL LEGAL QUALITY OF U.S. NOTES NOW OUTSTANDING AND SHALL BE IN AMOUNT OF $5 TO $10,000 IN ORDER TO CARRY OUT ONE PURPOSE OF THE AMENDMENT; I.E., TO SECURE GOV'T. NOTES IN PLACE OF BANK NOTES.  (P. 4023-1)
TO PASS H.R. 7618, A BILL AUTHORIZING THE BENTON WALTER CO., ITS SUCCESSORS, OR ASSIGNS, TO CONSTRUCT A DAM ACROSS SNAKE RIVER, WASHINGTON.  (P. 4227)

TO TABLE H.R. 20310, (APP. 4-22-08, 35 STAT. L. 65), A BILL RELATING TO THE LIABILITY OF COMMON CARRIERS TO THEIR EMPLOYEES IN CERTAIN CASES; WHICH AMENDMENT PROPOSES THAT EVERY COMMON CARRIER ENGAGED IN COMMERCE BETWEEN THE SEVERAL STATES, DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA OR POSSESSIONS OF THE U.S., SHALL BE LIABLE IN DAMAGES TO ANY PERSON INJURED AND IN CASE OF DEATH, TO HIS OR HER PERSONAL REPRESENTATIVE FOR REMAINING KIN, SAME RESULTING IN WHOLE OR IN PART FROM NEGLIGENCE OF SAID CARRIER, ACTION TO START WITHIN ONE YEAR FROM THE DAY CAUSE OF SAME ACCURED, WHICH SHALL BE DETERMIN- ED BY JURY TRIAL.  (P. 4538-1)

TO AMEND H.R. 20310, BY LIMITING ACTION TO RECOVER DAMAGES FOR INJURY OR DEATH AGAINST A COMMON CARRIER TO THOSE ACTUALLY ENGAGED AS AN EMPLOYEE OF SUCH CARRIER IN ASSISTING SAID CARRIER IN CONDUCTING SUCH COMMERCE, THE SAID INJURY OR DEATH BEING SO INFLICTED ON SUCH EMPLOYEE BY OR FROM CAUSES INCIDENT TO HIS OCCUPATION AND NOT OTHERWISE.

TO AMEND H.R. 20310, BY PROVIDING THAT SUITS INSTITUTED IN STATE COURTS FOR INJURIES OR DEATH RESULTING FROM NEGLIGENCE OF COMMON CARRIERS ORGANIZED UNDER STATE LAWS, OR FROM THE NEGLIGENCE OF THEIR AGENTS, OFFICERS OR SERVANTS, WHILE ENGAGED IN INTERSTATE OR FOREIGN COMMERCE, SHALL NOT BE REMOVABLE TO THE COURTS OF THE U.S.  (P. 4544-2)
TO TABLE AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 20310, WHICH AMENDMENT PROPOSES THAT ALL QUESTIONS OF FACT RELATING TO THE NEGLIGENCE OF COMMON CARRIERS SHALL BE DETERMINED BY A JURY. (P. 4550)
TO CONSIDER S. 122, A BILL AUTHORIZING THE PURCHASE OF SITES IN THE US., FOR THE ACCOMODATION OF PUBLIC BUILDINGS FOR THE USE OF THE GOVERNMENT OF THE U.S. (P. 4758)
TO PASS S. 122, A BILL AUTHORIZING THE PURCHASE OF SITES FOR PUBLIC BUILDINGS IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.

TO AMEND S. 4855, A BILL APPROPRIATING THE RECEIPTS FROM THE SALE AND DISPOSAL OF PUBLIC LANDS IN CERTAIN STATES TO THE CONSTRUCTION OF WORKS FOR THE DRAINAGE OR RECLAMATION OF SWAMPS AND OVERFLOWED LANDS OF THE U.S., BY STRIKING OUT ALL AFTER THE ENACTING CLAUSE, AS A TEST QUESTION ON SUBJECT OF OFFERING A SUBSTITUTE FOR THIS BILL.

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 20471, (APP. 5-13-08) (0), A BILL APPROPRIATING MONEY FOR THE NAVAL SERVICE FOR THE FIS- CAL YEAR ENDING 6/30/1909, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES, BY EM- PLOYING THE BEST RESPONSIBLE BIDDER FOR SHIP BUILDING; THE AMENDMENT TO AMENDMENT BEING TO DISREGARD REFERENCE TO CITIZENSHIP AND NATIONALITY OF THE BIDDER OF THE LOCATION OF OF HIS SHIPYARD.  (P. 5104-2)

TO TABLE, THE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 20471, WHICH AMENDMENT PROPOSES TO ELIMINATE THE CLAUSE PROVIDING THAT ALL MATERIAL USED IN THE CONSTRUCTION OF VESSELS FOR THE U.S. NAVY INCLUDING STEEL, SHOULD BE OF DOMESTIC MANUFACTURE.

TO AMEND H.R. 20471, BY PROPOSING THAT THE SECRETARY OF THE NAVY BE AUTHORIZED TO PURCHASE MATERIAL ABROAD WHEN SAME OF DOMESTIC MANUFACTURE CAN NOT IN HIS JUDGMENT BE PURCHASED AT A REASONABLE PRICE, HAVING REGARD TO COST OF MANUFACTURE AND A REASONABLE PROFIT THEREIN.  (P. 5108-1)
TO AMEND H.R. 20471, BY AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO HAVE CONSTRUCTED FOUR, INSTEAD OF TWO, FIRST CLASS BATTLE SHIPS. (P. 5290-2)

TO AMEND H.R. 20471, BY PROVIDING THAT ALL MATERIALS USED IN THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE VESSELS AUTHORIZED BY THIS ACT, WHETHER IN GOV'T NAVY YARDS OR BY CONTRACT, MAY BE PURCHASED ABROAD AND ADMITTED FREE OF DUTY, AND SHALL BE OF AMERICAN PRODUCT AND MANUFACTURE.  (P. 5291-2)

TO AMEND H.R. 19158, (APP. 5-23-08), A BILL APPROPRIATING FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, BY REDUCING THE AMOUNT APPROPRIATED FOR SAID SURVEYS FROM $333,460 TO $200,000.  (P. 5473-1)

TO AMEND S. 4812, (APP. 5-28-08, 35 STAT. 420), A BILL REGULATING EMPLOYMENT OF CHILD LABOR IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, BY EXEMPTING MERCANTILE ESTABLISHMENTS, STORES, AND BUSINESS OFFICES FROM THE PROVISIONS OF THE BILL, SO AS ALLOW BOYS OVER 14 YEARS OF AGE TO WORK IN THESE PLACES. (P. 5791-1)
TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT TO S. 4812, WHICH AMENDMENT ALLOWS BOYS OVER 14 TO WORK IN MERCANTILE ESTABLISHMENTS. (P. 5802-1)

TO AMEND S. 4812, BY AUTHORIZING THE JUDGE OF THE JUVENILE COURT OF DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA IN THE RIGHT TO ISSUE A PERMIT FOR A DEFINITE TIME OF EMPLOYMENT TO ANY CHILD BETWEEN 12 AND 14 YRS. OF AGE FOR ANY OCCUPATION NOT DANGEROUS OR INJURIOUS TO THE HEALTH OF THE CHILD, UPON APPLICATION OF PARENT OR GUARDIAN, PROVIDING SUCH EMPLOYMENT IS ABSOLUTELY NECESSARY TO SUPPORT A DISABLED PARENT, AGED MOTHER OR YOUNGER MEMBER OF THE FAMILY, SUCH PERMIT IS REVOKABLE BY JUDGE OR HIS SUCCESSOR.  (P. 5802-2)

TO AMEND H.R. 19158, (APP. 5-23-08), A BILL APPROPRIATING MONEY FOR USE OF AGRICULTURAL DEPT. BY INCREASING THE APPROPRIATION FROM $500,000 TO $1,000,000 IN ACCORDANCE WITH RECOMMENDATION OF SECY. OF AGRICULTURE, FOR PERMANENT CONSTRUCTION AND MAINTENANCE OF ROADS, BRIDGES, TRAILS, TELEPHONE LINES, CABINS AND FENSES, FOR THE PROPER AND ECONOMICAL ADMINISTRATION, PROTECTION AND DEVELOPMENT OF THE NATIONAL FORESTS.  (P. 6075-1,2)

TO DECIDE IF AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 18347, (5-27-08), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE SERVICE OF THE POST-OFFICE DEPARTMENT FOR FISCAL 1909, IS IN ORDER.  THE AMENDMENT AUTHORIZES THE POSTMASTER GENERAL TO USE SECOND AND THIRD CLASS VESSELS AT CERTAIN RATES FOR PAY FOR MAIL SERVICE, WHOSE ROUTES TAKE THEM TO SOUTH AMERICA, THE PHILIPPINES, JAPAN, CHINA, AND AUSTRALASIA.  (P. 6129)

TO TABLE AN AMENDMENT TO A MOTION POSTPONING CONSIDERATION OF S. 5729 (APP. 3-3-09), A BILL CORRECTING RECORDS AND AUTHORIZING RE-ENLISTMENT OF CERTAIN NON-COMMISSIONED OFFICERS AND ENLISTED MEN, WHICH AMENDMENT PROPOSES TO MAKE THE BILL THE SPECIAL ORDER FOR SATURDAY MAY 16, INSTEAD OF DEC. 16, 1908.
TO MAKE S. 5729 (APP. 3-3-09), A SPECIAL ORDER FOR DEC. 16, 1908.  S. 5729 IS A BILL CORRECTING THE RECORDS AND AUTHORIZING RE-ENLISTMENT OF CERTAIN NON-COMMISSIONED OFFICERS AND ENLISTED MEN.

TO TABLE AN AMENDMENT TO S.J.RES. 74, SUSPENDING THE COMMODITY CLAUSE OF THE PRESENT INTERSTATE COMMERCE LAW, WHICH AMENDMENT PROPOSES TO MAKE IT UNLAWFUL FOR ANY COMMON CARRIER AMENABLE TO THIS ACT, TO CHARGE MORE FOR TRANSPORT- TING FREIGHT OR PASSENGERS FOR A SHORTER THAN FOR A LONGER DISTANCE OVER THE SAME LINE AND IN THE SAME DIRECTION, THE SHORTER BEING INCLUDED IN WHOLE OR IN PART WITH THE LONGER DISTANCE.
TO PASS H.R. 21871, (APP. 5-30-08, 35 STAT. L. 546), A BILL AMENDING THE NATIONAL BANKING LAWS.

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 21897, (APP. 5-30-08, 35 STAT. 520), A BILL AUTHORIZING THE ENLARGEMENT, EXTEN- SION, REMODELING OR IMPROVEMENT OF CERTAIN PUBLIC BLDGS, THE ERECTION AND COMPLETION OF PUBLIC BUILDINGS, AND THE PURCHASE OF SITES FOR PUBLIC BUILDINGS AND OTHER PURPOSES, BY REDUCING THE APPROPRIATION FOR PURCHASING OF A SUITABLE EMBASSY IN PARIS FROM $400,000 TO $200,000.  (P. 6587-1)

TO AMEND S.J.RES. 74, SUSPENDING THE COMMODITY CLAUSE OF THE PRESENT INTERSTATE-COMMERCE LAW; BY MAKING IT UNLAWFUL FOR ANY RAILROAD COMPANY TO TRANSPORT ARTICLES OR ANY COMMODITY OTHER THAN TIMBER, AND THE MANUFACTURED PRODUCTS THEREOF, MANUFACTURED, MINED, OR PRODUCED BY IT OR UNDER ITS AUTHORITY, OR WHICH IT MAY OWN, OR BASE AN INTEREST IN, EXCEPT THOSE AS MAY BE NECESSARY AND INTENDED FOR ITS USE IN THE CONDUCT OF ITS BUSINESS AS A COMMON CARRIER; PROVIDED, THAT THE PROVISIONS OF THIS PARAGRAPH SHALL NOT APPLY TO ANY ARTICLE OR COMMODITY ACQUIRED AND OWNED PRIOR TO JUNE 29, 1906, BY ANY RAILROAD COMPANY.  (P. 6753-2)
TO REFER TO THE COMMITTEE ON PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS, S.J.RES. 91, PROPOSING A CONSTITUTIONAL AMENDMENT PERMITTING THE ELECTION OF SENATORS BY A DIRECT VOTE OF THE PEOPLE. (P. 6805-2)
TO PASS, OVER THE OBJECTIONS OF THE PRESIDENT, H.R. 15444, (5-25-08), A BILL EXTENDING THE TIME FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF A DAM ACROSS RAINY RIVER.  (P. 6823-1)

TO AMEND H.R. 21957, (APP. 5-23-08, 35 STAT. L. 600), A BILL RELATING TO AFFAIRS IN THE TERRITORIES; BY PROPOSING NOT TO GRANT A LICENSE FOR THE SALE OF INTOXICATING BEVERAGES UNLESS A MAJORITY VOTE OF MALE AND FEMALE CITIZENS, WITHIN A RADIUS OF TWO MILES, HAVE AGREED THERETO.  (P. 6827-1)

TO AGREE TO THE REPORT OF THE CONFERENCE COMMITTEE REGARDING AMENDMENTS TO S. 6190, (APP. 5-29-08, 35 STAT. 6. 465), A BILL AUTHORIZING A RESURVEY OF CERTAIN TOWNSHIPS IN THE STATE OF WYOMING.  (P. 7042-1)

TO ALLOW ROBERT LA FOLLETTE TO PROCEED IN ORDER, WITH HIS REMARKS ON THE REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE OF CONFERENCE ON H.R. 21871, (APP. 5-30-08, 35 STAT. 546), A BILL AMENDING THE NATIONAL BANKING LAWS.  (P. 7168-1)

TO DECIDE A POINT OF ORDER, DURING CONSIDERATION OF THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 21871, (APP. 5-30-08, 35 STAT. 546), A BILL AMENDING THE NATIONAL BANKING LAWS; POINT RAISED TO OBTAIN SENATE OPINION OF SENATOR ALDRICH'S CONTENTION THAT IT IS NOT IN ORDER FOR A SENATOR TO SUGGEST THE ABSENCE OF A QUORUM IF NO BUSINESS HAS INTERVENED AFTER A ROLL CALL HAS DISCLOSED ITS PRESENCE.

TO TABLE APPEAL FROM THE DECISION OF THE CHAIR MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 21871, (APP. 5-30-08,35 STAT. 546), WHICH WAS THAT A ROLL CALL HAVING DETERMINED THE PRESENCE OF QUORUM, AND NO BUSINESS HAVING INTERVENED SINCE, IT WAS NOT NOW IN ORDER TO SUGGEST A LACK OF A QUORUM.
TO AGREE TO THE REPORT OF THE CONFERENCE COMMITTEE REGARDING AMENDMENTS TO H.R. 21871.  (P. 7105-1)

TO TABLE AN APPEAL FROM THE CHAIR'S DECISION, MADE DURING DEBATE ON H.R. 21871, WHICH DECISION RULED THAT SENATOR ALDRICH WAS IN ORDER AND ENTITLED TO RECOGNITION BY THE CHAIR WHEN HE MADE A MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH THE CONFERENCE REPORT WAS AGREED TO.  (P. 7260-1)
TO TABLE A MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE ADOPTION OF THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 21871.

TO PROCEED TO THE CONSIDERATION AND DISCUSSION OF H.R. 21844, (APP. 5-30-08, 35 STAT. 556), A BILL GRANTING TO CERTAIN EMPLOYEES OF THE U.S. THE RIGHT TO RECEIVE COMPENSATION FOR INJURIES SUSTAINED IN THE COURSE OF THEIR EMPLOYMENT.  (P. 7265)

TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION ORDERING THE JUDICIARY COMMITTEE TO REPORT TO THE SENATE WHETHER THE PRESIDENT WAS AUTHORIZED TO PERMIT THE ABSORPTION OF THE TENNESSEE COAL AND IRON CO., BY THE U.S. STEEL CORPORATION AS SEEN IN THE MESSAGE OF THE PRESIDENT IN REPORT TO SENATE RES. 240 DURING THE PRESENT SESSION.  (P. 624-1)

TO AMEND H.R. 16954, A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE TAKING OF THE U.S. CENSUS, BY EXTENDING CIVIL SERVICE COVERAGE TO ADDI- TIONAL CLERKS AND OTHER EMPLOYEES, EXCEPT MESSENGERS, ASSIST. MESSENGERS, WATCHMEN, UNSKILLED LABORERS, AND CHAR- WOMEN.  (P. 642-1)

TO DECIDE A POINT OF ORDER RAISED DURING DEBATE ON H.R. 23464, (APP. 3-3-1909), A BILL APPROPRIATING FOR THE LEGISLATIVE, EXECUTIVE AND JUDICIAL EXPENSES OF THE GOVERNMENT FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1910 AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES; WHICH POINT OF ORDER IS THAT THE AMENDMENT INCREASING THE SALARY OF THE SPEAKER OF THE HOUSE TO $20,000 A YEAR AFTER MARCH 3, 1909, IS OUT OR ORDER. (P. 1038-1,2)
TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO H.R.23464, BY PROVIDING THAT THE SALARY OF THE SPEAKER OF THE HOUSE AFTER MAR. 3, 1909, SHALL BE $15,000 A YEAR INSTEAD OF $20,000.  (P. 1039-1)
TO AMEND H.R. 23464, BY PROVIDING THAT THE SALARY OF THE SPEAKER OF THE HOUSE BE INCREASED FROM $12,000 TO $15,000 PER YEAR, AFTER MAR. 3, 1909.  (P. 1040-1,2,1039-1,2)

TO REFER TO THE COMMITTEE ON THE JUDICIARY THE RESOLUTION DIRECTING THE U.S. ATTORNEY-GENERAL TO TELL THE SENATE WHETHER THE PRESIDENT ORDERED THE INVESTIGATION IN REGARD TO VARIOUS PRESS DISPATCHES ON THE PURCHASE OF THE PANAMA CANAL, UNDER WHAT STATUTES PROCEEDINGS WERE BEGUN, AND BY WHAT RIGHT AND AUTHORITY THE FEDERAL COURTS ARE BEING USED. (P. 1020-2)
TO AMEND H.R. 23464 BY PROVIDING $5,000 FOR UPKEEP AND MAINTENANCE OF CARRIAGE AND HORSE FOR USE OF THE SPEAKER OF THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES.  (P. 1084-1)
TO AMEND H.R. 23464, BY PROVIDING THAT THE SALARY OF THE PRESIDENT OF THE U.S. SHALL BE $75,000 A YEAR, WHICH SHALL INCLUDE TRAVELING EXPENSES.  (P. 1092-2,1093-1)
TO AMEND H.R. 23464, BY APPROPRIATING $100,000 A YEAR AFTER MAR. 3, 1909, FOR THE SALARY OF THE PRESIDENT OF THE U.S. (P. 1096-1)
TO AMEND H.R. 23464, BY REDUCING PROPOSED SALARY OF 29 CIRCUIT JUDGES FROM $10,000 TO $8,000 A YEAR.  (P. 1207-2)
TO AMEND H.R. 23464, BY FIXING THE SALARY OF THE DISTRICT COURT JUDGES AT $9,000 A YEAR.  (P. 1208-2)
TO AMEND H.R. 23464, BY FIXING THE SALARY OF THE CHIEF JUSTICE, OF THE COURT OF APPEALS, DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, AT $8,000 A YEAR.  (P. 1225-1)

TO AMEND S.J.RES. 117, CENTENARY OF BIRTH OF ABRAHAM LINCOLN, BY APPROPRIATING $50,000 FOR SURVEY, PLANS, AND ESTIMATES OF COSTS FOR CONSTRUCTING A NAT'L HIGHWAY CALLED "LINCOLN WAY" FROM WASH. TO THE BATTLEFIELD OF GETTYSBURG, AS A MEMORIAL TO ABRAHAM LINCOLN.  (P. 1291-1)
TO AMEND H.R. 23464, BY REDUCING THE COMPENSATION OF THE PRESIDENT FROM $100,000 TO $75,000 A YEAR, INCLUDING TRAVELING AND SIMILAR EXPENSES.  (P. 1293-2)
TO PROCEED TO CONSIDERATION OF EXECUTIVE BUSINESS. (P. 1463-2)
TO GO INTO EXECUTIVE SESSION.

TO AMEND H.R. 26394, (APP. 3-3-09), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR NAVAL SERVICE FOR FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1910, BY PROVIDING THAT NO PART OF THE APPROPRIA- TION MADE FOR MARINE CORPS SHALL BE USED UNLESS OFFICERS AND ENLISTED MEN SERVE ON BOARD BATTLESHIPS AND CRUISERS AND UPON SUCH OTHER VESSELS OF THE NAVY AS PRESIDENT MAY DIRECT IN DETACHMENTS OF NOT LESS THAN 8% OF THE STRENGTH OF THE ENLISTED MEN OF THE NAVY ON SAID VESSEL.  (P. 2543-1)
TO AMEND H.R. 26394 (APP. 3-3-09), A BILL APPROPRIATING FOR THE NAVY FOR FISCAL 1910, BY AUTHORIZING THE CONSTRUCTION OF AUXILIARY SHIPS NOT TO EXCEED A COST OF $9 MILLION.

TO AMEND H.R. 26203, (APP. 3-3-09), A BILL APPROPRIATING FOR PAYMENT TO INVALIDS FOR FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1910, BY RETAINING PRESENT PENSION AGENCIES AND NOT CONSOLIDATING THEM INTO ONE AGENCY AT WASHINGTON, D.C.  (P. 2679)

TO AMEND H.R. 27523, (APP. 3-3-09), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIA- TIONS FOR THE DIPLOMATIC AND DIPLOMATIC SERVICE FOR YEAR ENDING 6/30/1909, BY PROVIDING $400,000, OR SO MUCH THERE- OF AS NECESSARY FOR THE PURCHASE OF BLDG AND GROUNDS OR OF A SITE AND THE ERECTION OF A BLDG THEREON, IN THE CITY OF PARIS, FRANCE FOR THE USE OF THE EMBASSY, AND FOR THE RESIDENCE OF THE AMBASSADOR AND FOR ITS FURNISHINGS, IF NECESSARY, OR OTHERWISE ADAPTING IT TO THE NEEDS OF THE SERVICE.

TO AMEND IN COMM. OF THE WHOLE H.R. 27054, (APP. 3-3-09), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR FORTIFICATIONS AND OTHER WORKS OF DEFENSE FOR THE ARMAMENT THEREOF, FOR THE PROCURE- MENT OF HEAVY ORDNANCE FOR TRIAL AND SERVICE AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES, BY INCREASING THE APPROPRIATION FROM $250,000 TO $400,000 FOR PURCHASE OF LAND IN LOS ANGELES COUNTY, CALIF., AT A PORT CALLED SAN PIEDRO, AND USE SAME FOR FORTIFICATION AND DEFENSE.  (P. 233-2)

TO AMEND H.R. 27054, (APP. 3-3-09), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR FORTIFICATIONS AND OTHER WORKS OF DEFENCE FOR THE ARMAMENT THEREOF, FOR THE PROCUREMENT OF HEAVY ORDNANCE FOR TRIAL AND SERVICE AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES, BY INCREASING APPROPRIATION FROM $250,000 TO $400,000 FOR PURCHASE OF LAND IN LOS ANGELES COUNTY, CALIF., AT A PORT CALLED SAN PIEDRO, FOR USE AS A FORTIFICATION AND COAST DEFENSE.  (P. 2934-2)

TO AMEND S. 5729, (APP. 3-3-09), A BILL CORRECTING THE RECORDS AND AUTHORIZING THE REENLISTMENT OF CERTAIN NON- COMMISSIONED OFFICERS AND ENLISTED MEN BELONGING TO CO'S., B, C, AND D, OF THE 20TH INFANTRY, WHO WERE DISCHARGED WITHOUT HONOR UNDER SPECIAL ORDERS, #266 WAR DEPT., NOV. 9, 1906, AND RESTORING ALL RIGHTS WHICH THE MEN HAD BEEN DEPRIVED OF BY PROVIDING THAT ANY NON-COMMISSIONED OFFICER OR PRIVATE, WHO WAS ELIGIBLE FOR RE-ENLISTMENT, AND HAS RE-ENLISTED SHALL BE CONSIDERED TO HAVE ENLISTED IMMEDI- ATELY AFTER HIS DISCHARGE, AND HE SHALL BE ENTITLED TO AL- LOWANCES AND OTHER RIGHTS ACCORDING TO HIS RANK, FROM SAID DATE OF DISCHARGE.  (P. 2947-1)

TO PASS S. 5729, (APP. 3-3-09), A BILL CORRECTING THE RECORD AND AUTHORIZING THE REENLISTMENT OF CERTAIN NON-COMMISSIONED OFFICERS AND ENLISTED MEN BELONGING TO COMPANIES B, C, AND D OF THE 20TH INFANTRY, WHO WERE DISCHARGED WITHOUT HONOR UN- DER SPECIAL ORDER #266 WAR DEPT., NOV. 9, 1906, AND RESTORATION OF ALL RIGHTS OF WHICH THEY HAVE BEEN DEPRIVED.

TO DECIDE POINT OF ORDER RAISED DURING DEBATE ON H.R. 27053, (APP. 3-3-09), A BILL APPROPRIATING FOR THE DEPT. OF AGRIC. FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1910, WHICH POINT OF ORDER IS THAT THE AMENDMENT APPROPRIATING $25,000 TO HAVE THE SECRETARY OF AGRIC. COMPILE AND PUBLISH MATERIAL ALREADY GATHERED BY THE COMMISSION ON COUNTRY LIFE IS OUT OF ORDER.

TO DECIDE POINT OF ORDER RAISED DURING DEBATE ON H.R. 27053, WHICH POINT OF ORDER IS THAT THE AMENDMENT DIRECTING THE SECRETARY OF AGRICULTURE TO ELIMINATE FROM ALL FOREST RESERVES IN COLORADO AND IDAHO ALL SECTIONS OF PUBLIC LAND NON-TIMBERED, AND TO RESTORE THESE NON-TIMBERED LANDS TO LOCATION AND PURCHASE UNDER U.S. LAWS, AND DIRECTING THE AGRICULTURE SECRETARY TO REPORT ON FIRST MONDAY IN DEC. 1909, OR EARLIER, THE QUANTITY OF NON-TIMBERED LANDS. (P. 3251-2)
TO TABLE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 27053, WHICH AMENDMENT REDUCES AMOUNT APPROPRIATED FROM $38,8986,000 TO $3,160,000.

TO TABLE S. RES. 306, DISCHARGING THE COMMITTEE ON THE JUDICIARY FROM FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF S. 8462, A BILL PROHIBITING THE INTERMARRIAGE OF ANY WHITE PERSON TO A NEGRO IN THE D.OF C. OR IN ANY U.S. TERRITORY, AND MAKING THE ISSUANCE OF SUCH MARRIAGE, IF ANY, INCAPABLE OF INHERITANCE AND MAKING PENALTIES FOR VIOLATIONS.  (P. 3483-1)
TO PROCEED TO CONSIDERATION OF THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON S. 2982, (APP. 3-4-09, 35 STAT. 1169), A BILL CODIFYING, REVISING, AND AMENDING THE PENAL LAWS OF THE U.S.

TO LAY ASIDE, TEMPORARIALY, FOR THE CONSIDERATION OF MORNING BUSINESS, THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON S. 2982, (APP. 3-4-09, 35 STAT. L. 1169), A BILL CODIFYING, REVISING, AND AMENDING THE PENAL LAWS OF THE U.S.  (P. 3601-1)

TO PASS S. 8899, (APP. 3-3-09), A BILL GRANTING PENSIONS AND INCREASING PENSIONS TO SOLDIERS AND SAILORS OF WARS OTHER THAN THE CIVIL WAR AND TO CERTAIN WIDOWS AND DEPENDENT RELATIVES OF SUCH SOLDIERS AND SAILORS.  (P. 3611-1,3612-2)

TO PROCEED TO CONSIDERATION OF CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 28167, (APP. 3-3-09), A BILL GRANTING ADDITIONAL AUTHORITY TO THE SECRETARY OF TREASURY TO CARRY OUT CERTAIN PROVISIONS OF PUBLIC BUILDING ACTS, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES.
TO PROCEED TO CONSIDERATION OF THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 28059, (APP. 3-3-09), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE SUPPORT OF THE MILITARY ACADEMY FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1910.

TO REFER TO THE COMMITTEE ON JUDICIARY THE RESOLUTION DEALING WITH RELATIONS BETWEEN CONGRESS AND EXECUTIVE DEPTS. STATING THAT ANY PUBLIC DOCUMENTS, PAPERS, OR RECORDS ON THE FILES OF ANY DEPARTMENT OF THE GOVERNMENT RELATING TO ANY SUBJECT OVER WHICH CONGRESS HAS ANY AUTHORITY IS SUBJECT TO THE CALL AND INSPECTION OF THE SENATE.  (P. 3739-2)

TO TABLE AMENDMENT TO H.J.RES. 235, (APP. 3-3-09), REQUESTING PRESIDENT OF U.S. TO RENEW NEGOTIATIONS WITH RUSSIA AND SECURE BY TREATY OR OTHERWISE, UNIFROMITY OF TREATMENT AND PROTECTION OF AMERICAN CITIZENS HOLDING LEGAL PASSPORTS OF THE U.S., WHICH AMENDMENT APPROPRIATES $150,000 TO PAY EXPENSE OF HOLDING CONSTITUTIONAL CONVENTIONS BY PEOPLE OF NEW MEXICO AND ARIZONA.
